detailsOfAchievement: AXSHAYA PROJECT (UNDER CATHOLIC HEALTH ASSOCIATION OF INDIA)  this project is focused primarily on creating awareness on Tuberculosis. We have been working on this project continuously for the last five years, across various blocks of Ranchi district. Under this we organize GKS meeting, Mid-Media programme, door to door survey and other activities to create awareness. Last year itself we organized 45 GKS meetings, covered approx 7000 households, and checked for 300 cases showing symptoms of TB and diagnosed 25 cases that are currently put on the DOTs programme. FINANCIAL INCLUSION PROGRAMME (UNDER NABARD)  under this programme we work on creating awareness on the facilities provided by the banks to the villages living in the remote areas who dont have direct access to banking facilities through street plays, wall writing and various other platforms. We have approximately covered around 1000 villages in the last two years linking around 22000 people with the banking facility. SHG FORMATION AND MOBILISATION (UNDER NABARD)  in this programme we create several groups of women to make them self dependent and to earn for themselves. So far we have created 74 groups and provided them training for self employment and few of them have even been provided loans from the banks to start their own work. PANCHAYATI RAJ INCLUSION CAMP (UNDER NABARD)  this project focuses on creating awareness and providing knowledge to the head of the villages so that they can work for the growth of their respective villages. SKILL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME (UNDER DEPARTMENT OF LABOU, TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT, GOVERNMENT OF JHARKHAND)  under this programme we provided training and knowledge to the women under vocational training programme sot that they can be self dependent.

title: Yuva Rangmanch
detailsOfAchievement: With Some young artistes trained in NSD workshop held in Ranchi in 1981 along with some unemployed youths, hailing from tribal and backward areas and some engineers, journalists, teachers and industrial workers, Ajai Malkani along with Mr. Avinash Singh, Bipin Kumar etc. formed Yuva Rangmanch, with an aim to motivate common people through theatre and other cultural activities, ascertaining their active participation to bring about a change for the betterment of the society. The group has organized 40 Theatre workshops in the tribal region and has trained about 450 budding talents and has successfully given a scientific direction to the theatre movement in Jharkhand. The group has staged 350 shows of almost 40 plays inspiring both rural and urban youth. The group has staged two plays namely  ULGULAN KA ANT NAHI (Based on Indias Freedom struggle by Tribals against British Rule) and Kya Choot Raha hai (A Social and Philosophical manifestations) in Bharat Rang Mahotsav in the year 2001 and 2002 organized by national school of Drama (NSD) New Delhi. Besides founder director Ajai Malkani the group consists of Theatre professionals from NSD, BNA Lucknow and Department of Indian Theatre, Punjab University Yuva Rangmanch , besides being actively engaged in experimental innovation in modern Indian theatre, research and training , is also conducting experimentation and presentation of fine arts classical Kathak and folk dances in association with Haren Thakur , Subir Das ,Beena Tripathy ,Ankita Chakraborty, Gargi Malkani.and Malobika Mukherjee. Recently our Classical Kathak and Folk Dances have performed in 34th National Games organized at Khel Goan, Ranchi in the month of Feb 2011.
